website_summaries.verdict: A good-sized cage that fits most adult rabbits, though its bars can bend too easily.
pros: Removable bedding tray is sturdy, owners note
Plenty of height, and double doors are a nice plus
cons: Some owners would like a cage that is longer for larger rabbits
Small rabbits may have trouble with the side door
Assembly is a bit annoying due to cage hooks catching
Metal bars can bend out of shape
High-sided plastic protectors are delicious to some rabbits

customer_reviews.title: Update after buying larger cage.
customer_reviews.text: First is the small with a 1.9lb netherland dwarf. Second is the larger with a 7lb Satin angora: The tray is WAY too small. And the bar in front of it pulls all the bedding out when you clean it! It's also impossible to clean the bottom grate. It is not big enough for anything beyond a slieep/litter cage and is IMPOSSIBLE to easily clean the bottom grate wires. URINE GARDS ARE TERRIBLE! 1 corner of the cage only? COME ON! Please go to a rabbit supply vendor for a real cage.
customer_reviews.author: Anika

customer_reviews.title: Rabbit kennel.
customer_reviews.text: This cage is large height wise would've liked it a little longer in length for my bunny. However, it's pretty good quality and sturdy. The tray pan under kennel is a little hard to remove for cleaning and the metal flaps to stop urine is not that great as far as catching urine accidents but over all this is a nice kennel. My rabbit is 6 pounds. She still doesn't like the bottom grate of cage but she's gotten pretty use to it for the most part. Good cage for the price!!!
customer_reviews.author: SpecialK

customer_reviews.title: I like the pan under neath the cage
customer_reviews.text: I like the pan under neath the cage! The coated wires are nice, but my bunnies prefer a towel to sleep on. Also, the hay goes thru the wires, so a lot get's wasted,,, so I've started putting 2 towels in,,, one to sleep on or under and one for the hay. A word of caution about the door that opens on the side. 7 week old bunnies were having trouble navigating it and I didn't want one to get a broken leg so I took metal clips (like for food bags) and clipped a towel tightly across the door. Problem solved!
customer_reviews.author: Karen S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cage for Guinea Pigs
customer_reviews.text: After having 2 other cages and cleaning all that mess of my guinea pig every day I decided to buy this cage because of the tray. It was really easy to assemble, purchased some protective plastic feet pads and even build a second floor in wood. The tray saved my time by 80%, I purchased at the dollar store some bbq trays to put on top so every day ai just removed them and clean the whole mess without using any expensive and messy bedding stuff. It really makes the difference with the tray and my g.pig loves it, it doesnt hurt his feet at all.
customer_reviews.author: M. Keever

customer_reviews.title: Works...but could be better
customer_reviews.text: The idea if these are great. Rabbits like to pee in corners and jump around alot. Subsequently, you will end up with all that on your floor if you don't have guards up inside your cage. My issue with these are that the corners are sharp (potential injury to bunnies) and they fall down a lot. They come with these little hooks and are supposed to easily hook onto a wire cage, but they don't work super well and fell off a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Lindberg

customer_reviews.title: Love the cage and my rabbit seems very comfortable despite ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the cage and my rabbit seems very comfortable despite some peoples fears of 'wire' bottom cages. His pads on his paws are completely fine and he enjoys laying in it. Pretty easy to clean. Only drawback is that the spaces between the metal grate in the door are much too wide for a rabbits legs and they fall right through. I had to lay a cloth on it for him before he learned how to jump around it. Change the door to match that to the same small grate size on the cage bottom, then the cage will be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: What's best for Thumper!
customer_reviews.text: I love the size-most pets need a larger cage. It was so easy to set up, my 11yr old did it. The best part is the slide out tray so our bunny doesn't have to live in his own feces-yeah. I The metal is surfaces are smooth and of course the spacing is appropriate for bunnies-it's 1/2inx1in so their feet do not fall through. I only wish the urine guard prices covered the entire perimeter of the cage, but no manufacturer has that, and it's edges are sharp. I just took it out and use chucks /training pads under the cage -works great. I definitely recommend this bunny cage. Great price for a great cage!
customer_reviews.author: smartshopper

customer_reviews.title: The Cage Tray Melted In Under 10 Minutes Of Partial Sun
customer_reviews.text: After four days of use the tray has melted. I sat the Wabbitat on my covered porch on a 75 degree day. Within 10 minutes the tray had shriveled up and had a hole in it. I put my rabbit in a play cage on my porch in the shade. I stat the Wabbitat over to the side while getting my bunny settled. I then moved the cage and discoverer the melted tray. The porch floor was barely warm to the touch. Very poor quality plastic used of the trays.
customer_reviews.author: Danny BoydTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Not great for a Flemish or large rabbit, but good sized for a regular rabbit
customer_reviews.text: If you could leave half stars I prob would have left 3 1/2 stars, but only because my pieces were bent and some of the locks and hooks were on backwards preassembled. I have a Flemish rabbit so this cage is actually a little bit small for him, but it will work until he gets bigger. The hardware is cheap, it isn’t very sturdy. But, the price was unbeatable so I kept it to use for now. Mine also did not come with English instructions...thought I got instructions in every other language. It took us a while to assemble due to the mistakes.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Zaccagnino

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: The urine splash guards and their assembly/connection aren't very well designed, and the cage door closures can be quite stiff and difficult to open/close for a while, but generally a very good cage for the price. The cage isn't flimsy, but since it is collapsible, so things can get out of place. It can easily be made even more sturdy by using some wire, zip ties, cage clips or hog clips in a few places to make sure nothing gets out of whack over time or if they have to be moved. I've purchased 4 so far, using 2 for rabbits and 2 for quail. I really like how easy they have been to clean.
customer_reviews.author: G. Burke

customer_reviews.title: So many uses and price is fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 8 of these. I use them for chicks that are not big enough to go outside but too big for a brooder. We also use them to house chickens that need to be quarantined or seperated. Much easier than using dog kennels as you have a top access door which makes it easy to grab chickens out. We use these without the metal flooring as feed and bedding just fall through. We repurposed the flooring and use as lids to keep chicks junping out of our brooders. Price is excellent and they really have so many uses.
customer_reviews.author: Dayeonaira

customer_reviews.title: Can be tricky to clean
customer_reviews.text: I have a free range bunny who just needed a place to eat hay and use the bathroom. It serves its purpose very well except for the fact that it can be very hard to remove the bottom tray without making a mess. There is a bar that the tray clip attaches to that will catch on the hay that has fallen through into the very shallow pan. I am going to look into modifying it and will update the review shortly. UPDATE: I bought an $8 pair of bolt cutters and cut the bar off and cleaning is much easier. I can’t lock the pan anymore but that doesn’t bother me.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Violette

customer_reviews.title: So good, I bought three.
customer_reviews.text: I love the double openings. It is so easy to clean, and to place and remove the bunny and it's accessories. I had a second cage that only had a front opening which I had been using for years and I liked it fine: Until I got this one for a second bunny. After a month of using both cages, I had to buy myself a second one, to replace the front-opening-only cage. Then I had to buy one as a gift for my friend, because I knew it would make her life easier. It did. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Granny Sue

customer_reviews.title: Poop and Pee got everywhere...
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews before buying this, and I determined that maybe just the pee guards were too short. Since I was buying this for two guinea pigs, I thought it would still be ok. It came in, and we assembled it very easily. The problem was, the tray moved around... A LOT. I put my guinea pigs in the cage, and within an hour they had pooped and peed all over the floor. The cage is useless, I'm trying to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: K. Rigal

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised by how well this works!
customer_reviews.text: We got this cage for our baby chinchilla. She loves to chew on everything so we knew we couldn't get anything with plastic surround and wow this cage works wonders. While I wish it had a handle of some sort to carry in, it is super easy to assembly and even easier to clean. We use this as her travel cage when we go places where we'd like to bring her. She still tries to chew the outside but jokes on her because she won't be able to work her way out with the durable bars! Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: A.Montez

customer_reviews.title: The trays broke within the first month and the wire isn't great for rabbits.
customer_reviews.text: The cages were relatively easy to assemble but we were very disappointed in the quality of the trays, most of which have broken even with careful use. The wire on the bottom is not the correct gauge and spacing for rabbits---the animal for which the cages are intended. The space is much too large with thick wire and it hurts their feet. I purchased four of these when I got into rabbits and while we are still using them (some with broken trays and some with no trays because they came apart), I will never buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great cage for a hurt kitten!
customer_reviews.text: This was a perfect size cage for my rescue kitten. I found him in the middle of the road (think someone threw him out of a moving vehicle) His one front leg is paralyzed, the other front leg was strained, so he's having a difficult time walking. To keep him safe from my adult kitties I thought this cage would work and it did! I took out the bottom grate. Lined it with puppy pads, fleece blankets and a stuffed animal for my kitten. Nice size he'll be safe and has lots of room.
customer_reviews.author: FifteenCats

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best bunny cage I've used
customer_reviews.text: This is my second cage for my bunny. Our first one had a rubber/cloth-like bottom, and the bunny chewed right through it. This one is extremely easy to clean- just pull the tray out of the bottom. Pretty simple. Construction could be a bit easier, but it went together well enough. I don't think I'll be replacing it with anything else. If it breaks (i doubt it will), I'll probably buy another one of the same model.
customer_reviews.author: Brady N

customer_reviews.title: Good cage but not as easy to set up as they claim
customer_reviews.text: This cage is very nice, easy to clean and durable but definitely not as easy to set up as they say. It will take some patience on your part as some of the metal does not line up properly. Also if you have a rabbit you know that when they urinate it sometimes goes out the cage and the corner urine guards that come with the cage are not good at all. You may want to consider buying plexiglass from a local store and cutting and attaching them where you want them using zip ties.
customer_reviews.author: sophiasnanna

customer_reviews.title: Saved our lives
customer_reviews.text: These cages saved our lives. We moved and wanted to bring our rabbits with us, but didn’t have enough time to build their hutches. These cages have worked out well. I am in no rush to build the hutch because these cages are working great. Much better than the cages sold at tractor supply. Sturdy and with a plastic bottom. My one complaint is that the wire “floor” is not installed already. It is removable, which is not what I was looking for, but for those of you that want a removable bottom it is.
customer_reviews.author: == true;

customer_reviews.title: Good cage if you are looking for a small one.
customer_reviews.text: Good cage if you are looking for a small one. It fits in the space we need it for and is good quality. I wish I had room for a bigger one, but that is my issue, not the cage. The pee guards don't work so well. We ended up putting a litter box in the corner that the rabbit to use and put down plastic matts be be sure the wire doesn't hurt his paws. We used puppy pads below it just in case the rabbit does pee in the corners. Overall very satisfied with this cage for my mini holland lop.
customer_reviews.author: MaryRuth

customer_reviews.title: Nice cage but the door is a pain to open
customer_reviews.text: Overall I really like the set up of this cage. The size is perfect for our Netherland dwarf. The only thing I don’t like is it is kind of a pain to open the door. This is my 5 year olds rabbit and he is responsible for feeding and watering and there’s no way he can open the cage by himself if it’s shut all the way. We have to leave the latch a little loose so he is able to open it.
customer_reviews.author: KPat

customer_reviews.title: wire sags & pan is shallow
customer_reviews.text: Concept is good & nice doors but the wire is thin so sags & the slide-out pan is ridiculously shallow (just like the ones sold with dog crates). I'd recommend using this cage for smaller, light-weight rabbits only. For birds, it is suitable for pigeons & bantams (miniature chickens). Not sturdy enough to be safe for outdoor use--indoors only. It does fold up nicely for moving/storage & was easy to set up. I will definitely get good use out of it but probably wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Great cage, convenient and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is a good cage. It is big enough for my rabbit, it does not allow her to move a lot but it does let her lay down like she likes to. I don't know how much she weights, but she's a rather big bunny, mix between a California and a Rex, so I'd say she weights about 6 pounds. Assembling was easy and I love that you can fold it so we can travel with it (our previous cage did not fit in our car). I don't have many cons to this cage, just that the edges are sharp and cut my hand. It's just a scratch but y'all be careful when assembling.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Ikay
customer_reviews.text: Design flaw the tray fronts and wire needs more clearance there is waste if wire in the way that make it's hard to pull the trays out without getting poop everywhere. I have 6 of these right now stacked 3 high they dint sit well on each other I use short 2x4s to help balance or they collapse the tops. I've also now broken 2 trays... like.. I spend 400 on cages and am like of regretting it now
customer_reviews.author: rujia

customer_reviews.title: I love how it folds which makes it easy for transport ...
customer_reviews.text: I was very iffy on buying this cage after reading some of the reviews but I have had no issues with this cage at all! I love how it folds which makes it easy for transport and the cage was a perfect size for an 8 lb rabbit. As far as the urine spilling, we were told to put some kind of fluff on the bottom of that tray so it absorbs the pee and prevents it from smelling.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Great size but shallow pan. Product returned!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cage for my 2 guinea pigs. Its a big cage and more room for them to roam. However, the biggest downside is the tray at the bottom, it is shallow. If you put a bedding on it to catch their urine and waste, it is impossible to pull it out without making a whole lot of mess. Urine also leaks out of the cage. I love the size but this is not for rabbits or guinea pigs that requires bedding so ai sadly had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Daydreamer4

customer_reviews.title: Tray too small. Pee on the floor.
customer_reviews.text: All good except the tray underneath does not go all the way to the does and the bunny keeps peeing on the floor. There’s rabbit poo everywhere too. Came with two ‘pee guards’ that only go part of the way down the sides and only go on the sides. This would work if the tray actually fit and was a good deal deeper. Otherwise, we’re going to go through a bit of rigging to keep the pee and poo in the tray. Frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Holts

customer_reviews.title: great price
customer_reviews.text: The only problem I have with this cage is that we are using it for a rabbit and no matter what I do, she pees out the side. It only comes with a "urine guard" for 1 corner. I would like the option to purchase a whole cage guard. Otherwise this is a great cage for the price and I'm considering getting another one for the Guinea Pig.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Midwest Wabbitat Folding Rabbit Cage
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to house our new rescue rabbit. It's part of his enclosed space for when we are asleep or not home. The cage is well built and easy to put together. The bottom slides out for easy cleaning. As you can see there is enough room to include a little hideaway for the bunny. Prior to getting the extension it also held a small litter box. It would not be large enough to be the bunny's sole space for the animal needs room to run around. It is a great way to transport or as a starting point for a bunny habitat
customer_reviews.author: P. Woodland

customer_reviews.title: Urine gards poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: All I ordered was the urine gards to place in my chinchilla cage to try to keep the bedding in better so he's not kicking half of it out. As far as I can tell the hooks on all four I purchased are backwards compared to the pictures in the instructions and the metal is too hard to bend to turn them around. I can't get them on because of this and am going to have to purchase some kind of wire to attach them.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Hagar

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous cage
customer_reviews.text: This cage is cheaply made and is very dangerous. You need to have Tdap shot before using this product. It does the job but the sharp edge on every single wire will cut your hand or arm. During installation I cut myself 3 times and each led to bleeding. I strongly recommend you keep children away from this cage, and wear PPE every time you get in contact with this cage.
customer_reviews.author: B.C.

customer_reviews.title: Good, Collapsible Cage
customer_reviews.text: I needed a good solid cage for a new pet. It came flat and was easy to assemble. I used the tray and spray guard (though I rewired it to put it where I wanted it). Probably the only downside is that it is a little noisy. Because it came as a collapsible cage, the sides and top were a bit loose and it rattled a bit when my rabbit moved around. I solved the problem by using zip ties to pull the pieces together tightly. It's a great cage with easy setup and takedown.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and looks nice but small
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I love that this cage was easy to assemble and easy for my rabbits to get out of if I open the door for them. However, this is far too small for my two rabbits to do much other than eat and sleep, and we bought the large cage. It is quite skinny and short. Even if we only had 1 rabbit, I wish the cage was just a few inches larger in both length and width.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mini lionhead bunny and it is fantastic! Gives her plenty of room and easy to clean. One thing I did do was cut the bent parts off of the wire bottom. It was a bear to get out of the cage and I kept getting scratched! It is perfect since I did that. I just slide the tray out and put it into a leaf garage bag to empty it. Takes me no time to do!
customer_reviews.author: Roseann Young

customer_reviews.title: Rabbit Breeder says "AWESOME"!!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I breed and raise rabbits. We sell rabbits "for pet or plate" as we say. I have been building my own cages for the past 5 years and I'm pretty good at it. So, for me to say that "I'm very impressed" with the Wabbitat Folding Rabbit Cage means something! We're going to buy new residences for our 10 "Happy Humpers" of Humpersville!! Very nice cages; very good quality; very simple assembly!!
customer_reviews.author: Fish N Man

customer_reviews.title: Everything goes outside of the cage
customer_reviews.text: The rabbit can pee and poo outside the cage. The pan doesn’t completely cover the bottom and I just watched my bunny pee straight down. The borders they sent to protect it from this, do not line up or work. As soon as I put them on, she peed straight down onto the floor. I have to buy an outside cage now. I wish I could get my money back for this cage but I missed the return date by 1 day and am very disappointed with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Arianna plaisance

customer_reviews.title: More urine shields
customer_reviews.text: Great price, and as described, however urine shields are only provided for essentially one corner of the cage. There should be urine shields around the entire perimeter. We constantly have urine outside of the tray along the areas without the shields. ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Carrier Cage for farm use - economical and the clean out trays are an added bonus
customer_reviews.text: I love these cages, I have 2 of the extra large and 2 of the mediums that I use to transport my Chickens and Quail on / off the farm. They hold up quite nicely and are 1/2 the price of other "Dog" carriers I have for the same use. It is a lighter metal than the dog crates, but for my use they hold up well and I have carried up to 8 large birds in the extra large cage with no issues, other than my back when I tried to pick it up by myself :)
customer_reviews.author: Christine Perry

customer_reviews.title: Anyone paying attention?
customer_reviews.text: I actually really like this product. I purchased my first cage no problems. Love the cage so much I Purchased a second cage but the wire bottom is missing. I would like to contact the seller so I can be sent one without having to send the whole unit back. I have kits in need of more space before they could get one to me. However there is no way to do so. Hopefully this gets someone's attention! I will change my rating once I get my part. :)
customer_reviews.author: Aernifamily

customer_reviews.title: Missing hangars, good design, might not be suitable for smaller rabbits.
customer_reviews.text: The cage is pretty good. Its simple, easy to set up. I really liked the grate over the bedding design, but I'm already seeing problems with my Holland Lop, she does not like to go inside the cage, It may or may not hurt her feet, I'm not sure as I can't talk to rabbits. I bought two of these and one box did not come with the hangars for the splash pad, which is a little irritating but understandable.Splash barrier also does not fit right with the hangars, this could be due to user error, not sure. Considering all of that I would give this product a 3/5 star review.
customer_reviews.author: Morty

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good features.
customer_reviews.text: Nice cage for the price. Pretty sturdy. Has wire grate on bottom that is made comfortable for the rabbit. The one inside our outdoor hutch is great. The problems with the 3 inside is the low pans. Even with the urine guards, all 3 rabbits pee outside their cages because the pan is not tall enough, etc. There's a gap of a couple inches. And the pans aren't wide enough. Every day I have to clean up urine. I use dog pee pads I cut up and place around the cage. I called customer service and there was no solution, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca L.

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I bought it at a lesser price because the "box was damaged but product intact".....spoiler alert...product was not intact. My other complaint is I don't like the way the openings are secured. If something outdoors wanted to get in and tried hard enough it could. I reinforced it a bit. I would still buy the cage again though because it is a decent size. The bottom tray isn't the best material but since it sits under the wiring it doesn't cause much of an issue to the functionality of the cage itself.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed for my rabbits!
customer_reviews.text: The assembled parts were a bit difficult and confusing, but very sturdy. I bought 2 of these cages for both of my rabbits to make it easier for me to clean the cages than the cages without wired bottom. These cages are less hassle to clean which is perfect for me. I also bought mats with 2 different colors for my rabbits to protect their feet which is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Deaf Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would make a great cage for some lovebirds
customer_reviews.text: Would make a great cage for some lovebirds. Works for my rabbit who has vertigo and needs a wire bottom to walk. attach a playpen to either side so your bunny has plenty of space to hop around and explore (a small playpen with 8 panels costs as low as 20 bucks on amazon). wish the bottom were deeper. Great for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Chandler F

customer_reviews.title: Useful purchase
customer_reviews.text: I like the kennel. I use it for 2 small puppies. It was really hard to put the bottom shelf in the kennel. Once I finally got it was good and sturdy. The only thing else that’s a minor issue is the door in the middle of the kennel. The dogs have had a hard time getting out of it. But I figure they will eventually get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Great concept,  lots of design defects!
customer_reviews.text: Great concept - needs re-engineering. Love the top AND side doors for bunny access. 3 star rating on easy to clean because the pan is shallow. When pulling the pan out, the clumps get caught on the frame. Additionally, mine arrived bent and out of alignment, so the pan doesn't slide out nicely. The frame isn't super sturdy. Putting this together with the wire bottom was a nightmare! Nothing lined up. It took two of us to maneuver the sides so the bottom didn't keep catching. Just a lot of design defects that can be improved upon. The urine guards are great, but be prepared to use zip ties to hold them on - the "hooks" don't align.
customer_reviews.author: Traci Warner

customer_reviews.title: Bought for 3-6 wk old puppies
customer_reviews.text: The wire floor is really difficult to get in; mine arrive with many of the hooks bent, etc and they had to be straightened prior to putting in the wire floor. Once put together it worked nicely for what I wanted to use it for. I would not try to fold this back down, what a huge pain in the butt that would be so the convenience of travel is not there. We needed something in the RV for extremely young and small puppies before they are crate trained and before they are able to hold their potty through the night. etc
customer_reviews.author: sheltie

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what needed for a rabbit
customer_reviews.text: This was pretty easy to set up all you have to do is slide out of the box and fold up the sides and put the bottom in and add the urine shield and your ready to go in less then 10 mins you have your cage setup it’s very sturdy and a great size for large bunnies or dwarf bunnies easy to get them in and out and cleaning is easy with the slide out tray this was excellent product
customer_reviews.author: tracie

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cage!
customer_reviews.text: Love this cage it’s very easy to put together very convenient with the tray underneath! I love how there’s access to my bunny from the top and the front! It’s very easy to clean and it’s portable. My bunny does not stay in it all the time she is a free roam bunny .. but I really do like this cage!
customer_reviews.author: Christy p.

customer_reviews.title: not like it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 cages for my bunny..one in the garage and another in my house.so many negative things can say about this cage.more important-the cage easy to rust!,yes cage in the garage and house--never in outside got so much rust...and I have this cage only a few months...very unhappy with it..yes the plastic pan is very cheep,and thin,,more over it not wide like should be..unhappy with cage!!not healthy for bunny
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: needed accessory
customer_reviews.text: this is a necessary element to a rabbit cage as they can pee outside the walls and can throw materials out when chewing, playing, etc. This particular urine guard came missing one of the hooks needed to attach to the wire wall. Fortunately, I had ordered this as an extra urine guard as the cage I also bought had one included. I needed this for the opposite side. Fortunately, I didn't need to use both sides so the missing hook turned out to not be a big issue. In an pinch, I could have used a zip-tie or piece of wire instead.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Just want I've been needing.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my two story ferret cage and this is perfect and exactly what I needed. Works and would buy again. Purchased this on 2/20/20, today is 3/2/20 - I wanted to give it a good amount of time before giving a review. But I have been consistently pleased with the overall performance. Pictures provided after cleaning their cage.
customer_reviews.author: dani

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work Well for a Rabbit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my indoor rabbit because I needed something larger. I do not recommend this for a rabbit because the tray is not deep enough and the few side panels that come with it, don't keep the urine from going out the side of the cage leaving an icky mess on the floor. I've tried multiple things to address the issue, but had to go back to her smaller cage. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: purplelady

customer_reviews.title: I like it. One little drawback is that one of ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it. One little drawback is that one of the ends does not stay attached to the cage. My buck kept taking the end off and then urinating on that side. I finally took it off until I configure out a way to securely attach it so he is not able to remove it, and I will, just haven yet. I bought 2 and will be getting a second buck soon, however due to working 60 hours this week, I will need to figure out my attachment challenge next week.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Barnett

customer_reviews.title: I've purchased 18 of these
customer_reviews.text: Good size. Doors and latches are not all that easy on every one. Urine guards are too small, so plan on buying extras. The worst part about these is that the trays are pretty flimsy and brittle. At least a quarter of mine had to be replaced and the quality is highly variable. That's the one thing that makes me consider making my own cages for my breeding operation, rather than continuing to buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Bloch

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Clean
customer_reviews.text: PROS - easy to clean by pulling the tray out - good size for a 4 lb rabbit - grid mesh floor helps poo to go through - top and front door CONS - very sharp! the edges and hooks are so sharp that it may hurt your rabbit - no handle - door comes down like a ramp so your rabbit may not want to hop out of its cage
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Happy overall
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good size for a small 7lb dog. However, I had to add felt covering over the door/opening to make sure that she wouldn’t get her tiny paws stuck in between the wires. I also had to use felt to cover some of the sharp edges as they could scratch her and/or me. If you take the required safety measures it’s a pretty good crate! I should add that the bottom of the tray had many scratches and there was a bit of rust on the door where it latches on. The box it came in was completely destroyed like it was chewed on by rats or something. I’m glad the cage was okay but just FYI.
customer_reviews.author: Spiky

customer_reviews.title: Urine guard is lame
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cage to keep our rabbit in for just limited times in the house. Trying to put the urine guard in is impossible. The hooks doesn’t hold in the right place. Also the metal that slips into the other piece is dangerous sticking out. I do like the drawer that’s easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lee

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought a new cage.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this used so l expected issues but this cage was bent and really hard to make things line up. A good cage overall but no more buying used items ever again, at least nothing made of hard wire. It took over an hour to put together and that's way too long.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: This are a “must have” for rabbit owners. I have the small and medium size cages and I can get these to work in both. On the small cage I had to bend the end a little. It’s worth it though. The pee on the wall and all over the floor was out of control.
customer_reviews.author: Madtown

customer_reviews.title: Good strong cage. Great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: This cage should last a long time with good care. It should be cleaned and dried regularly. Don't leave the tray out in the hot sun to dry, like I did, or it will warp. Thankfully, customer service replaced mine They were very kind and took care of the replacement very fast.
customer_reviews.author: L. Acree

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!!!
customer_reviews.text: Would highly recommend this for a rabbit. Easy installation and the best one out there! Clean up is easy too! We have a litter box inside for our rabbit and it is convenient to take out through the upper door to clean. We open the front door so she can go in and out on her own when we are home. We wrap a small baby blanket around the door so she doesn’t get her paws stuck. “She’s tiny”
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits well in Critter Nation cage
customer_reviews.text: My young rats were squeezing behind corner litter pan and using it as their hang out spot. I got this urine guard and put it behind the litter pan to use as a scatter guard to keep the poop from getting push out of the cage in that corner. The bottom ledge of guard fit well under the Critter nation pan.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny

customer_reviews.title: This is a great buy and lightweight for portability
customer_reviews.text: This is a great buy and lightweight for portability, but if you are looking for quality, this is not it. The metal is cheap and bends easily. There is a concern using the latches because the metal is so sharp along the edges and the lock is not as secure. Suggesting utilizing a carabineer to secure the gate and using duck tape or electrical tape on the metal locks is recommended. I had to call the manufacturer to send urine guards which should've been included.
customer_reviews.author: Kimiko

customer_reviews.title: Shallow litter pan makes this a pain
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as we had acquired some bunnies from my cousin and needed homing solutions for them. The size of this cage is fantastic! The flooring is great. The shallow tray and the way it slides into the bottom is awful. It makes for cleaning out a large angora bunny a giant pain. There little round poops everywhere. When it slides out the floor of the cage pushes the poop and hay off the litter pan making this very difficult to use. We ended up buying a litter box for our bunnies
customer_reviews.author: Tegan Edgington

customer_reviews.title: Great for rabbits!!!
customer_reviews.text: the tray lock maybe on backward, at a minimum it doesn't work well, but the rest of the crate is great! I like that you can slide the tray out to clean. not sure if there is a stand for this but I purchased 2 and would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: shoemom

customer_reviews.title: Sharp edges on "urine guard"
customer_reviews.text: The so-called urine guard has sharp edges on the connector on the short piece, on which I cut a finger. It doesn't "guard" against urine leakage, which i have to clean off the floor daily. It is necessary only because the sides of the tray are so low they don't hold in the urine. The bottom wire floor also has dangerous wire tips. it is large, and I like the top door, but I would neither order it again, or recommend it to anyone else. The only reason I don't return it is my bunny would be without a place to live until I replaced it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size - Love the Pull-Out Tray
customer_reviews.text: Perfect bunny cage for our new addition. We have a mini-lop, who is about 4-5 lbs. There is plenty of room for her to stretch out in, even with a corner litter tray. It was hard to find the right size with the bottom pull-out tray. For the price, it was an excellent purchase and our bunny seems very happy/content.
customer_reviews.author: True Revu

customer_reviews.title: Just "ok"
customer_reviews.text: It's an ok cage. Do not really care for the front door lock. And there is no use in using the floor grate, because when you go to clean the cage & pull the tray out all of the bedding & rabbit waste gets scraped off the tray & goes everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Pan defective. Warps in summer light to clean
customer_reviews.text: A week after purchase, we went to clean the cage out and spray the plastic pan down. Just from the sun light in less than a few hours, the pan was completely warped. Not like the pans on dog cages. This is cheap. Now it has waves and kinks all over the pan. It’s harder to slide out now
customer_reviews.author: amtr

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy kennel tray, using for fake grass pee pad for dog
customer_reviews.text: This is sold for rabbits, but bought it to use with artificial grass for an indoor pee pad. The tray is very sturdy, and much cheaper than other dog pee pad setups and dog kennel trays. Very happy with the setup and sturdiness of the tray.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. & Mrs. Science lover

customer_reviews.title: Good rabbit cage
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and perfect size for our rabbit. He isn't in it all day but it's perfect for night time and when we are not home. **Update I now have 2 of these. Our rabbits do not stay in these all day but I like the eas of clean up from there overnight messes.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee

customer_reviews.title: Nice cage for a prospect grow out
customer_reviews.text: It is big, but it is long and narrow, i have a Rex jr doe in there now and she has plenty of room even with her dwarf sized nest box. It is very sturdy, could easily be hung or stacked. I love that it opens top and front. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Angela L.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cage
customer_reviews.text: I really like this cage, it's very sturdy. Was very easy to assemble & it's a good size. I have kept a chicken in it that I had to separate from the gang. The slide out tray makes it perfect for cleaning & it's in separate location so you don't have to go into cage to get it out. I also like that it has 2 doors, I've went in through both ways. I would definitely buy this again if I needed another one.
customer_reviews.author: cheyenne

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Eventually rusts.
customer_reviews.text: Decent piece. I wish the pieces didn't rust eventually. Like if they could be coated with something glossy. Also wish I could get a complete square urine gaurd for the cage that would fit it. But other than that it does the job
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: Quality could be better
customer_reviews.text: It was never delivered so Amazon fixed it and resent which was awesome. But when it came both the top and front door are not connected to the cage. I'm scared my bunny will try and squeeze through and get hurt because the door is crooked.
customer_reviews.author: LNCplus3

customer_reviews.title: It has potential...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted for my rabbit to love this cage. Unfortunately it was a bit of a downsize for him from his original cage and he was entirely uncomfortable. Most importantly, the corner borders that come with this cage (too make sure urine doesn't come out from the side) has sharp metal corners and was not flush to the sides of the cage at all. That being side, as my senior rabbit stumbled around I was deathly afraid he would catch one of those corners. I would *not* recommend the side borders at all...
customer_reviews.author: Khadijah

customer_reviews.title: Not for outdoor use
customer_reviews.text: As an indoor cage, this is great except our clever rabbit pees right out of it onto the floor- even with the urine guards. As an outdoor cage, we can sadly say for sure the welding is not good enough to withstand a raccoon. We are going to try making a sturdier outdoor hutch.
customer_reviews.author: K. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Not as Sturdy as it looks
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of this cage for my quails. Everything went alright until the plastic pans were exposed to direct 79F sun. The plastic "wilted" and shrank. One corner edge also broke when i pulled it from the steel cage with little force applied. Having 2nd thoughts recommending it at your own risk.
customer_reviews.author: Janyn Quiz

customer_reviews.title: Notice how I'm not amused..
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd one I've purchased. The first two had slight damages to the latches but workable enough for me to use. But by #3 I'm just not amused. Notice in picture. One door not even attached and the other one only being held by one loop. Okay, second picture is number 4. It's completely missing a loop for holding the side panel up. Don't get me wrong. I absolutely love these enclosures... But. This is just lazy production. Are the workers all Temps? Is QA sleeping? Prices increased and production just got worse.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Clanton

customer_reviews.title: Great size, comes with urine guard
customer_reviews.text: Great size, comes with urine guard, easy to construct cage for it to stand but takes some fanagling to get bottom grate in place. One of the welded wires came unwelded, parts of cage were not totally painted, closures for gates are awkward to use and plastic tray is a little warped. Do NOT use outside, rusts instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Online Sales

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy for an indoor cage
customer_reviews.text: Terrible design! The urine goes everywhere OUTSIDE the cage. The concept is good that the bunny doesnt sit on the shavings, but the grid that it stands on is too far away from the tray. Plus, the tray is too small for the actual cage. I have rabbit urine all over my carpet.
customer_reviews.author: juanapad

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: The cage came with the top door broken off. The grate bottom doesn't attach to the bottom of the cage, it was bent some how so it's basically useless now. If you didn't want the wire bottom then sure you could permanently secure the top door to the cage since its broken and use it like that. But when you order the cage wanting that bottom in the cage, it's a waste of money when you realize it's not going to work. Won't buy another that's for sure. I have my own Rabbitry and was looking to convert to these cages but glad I only bought one to try out first.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and plenty of space!
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect size for our Holland Lop Does that just had 5 kits. They needed more space and I use large plastic trash bags on the litter tray for easy clean up! The bunnies seem to enjoy the extra space and having two different ways to open is very nice. It also has urine guard which is very helpful. I was able to assemble this very quickly with no tools required!
customer_reviews.author: YogaEnergyTherapy

customer_reviews.title: Noisy
customer_reviews.text: It's a really good cage for my bunny. The only bad thing is that when she's jumping inside it makes a lot of noise so if you buy this you need to make sure to leave it in a room far away from your bedroom. Other than that it's big enough for an adult bunny :)
customer_reviews.author: Andrina

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it. No regrets. Bunny loves it too. It is easy to put together and was ready in no time ** To think, this was our 2nd choice after we ended up returning our preferred hutch (which came with some broken and flimsy parts). ** The 4 stars is only because the splash gaurd was a pain to install, and the fit is a little off. But that's us being pedantic.
customer_reviews.author: ABC

customer_reviews.title: It’s a good cafe for holding a rabbit in while you clean ...
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for a main cage for your rabbit\bunny I wouldn’t recomend this one.. It’s a good cafe for holding a rabbit in while you clean the other cage but not as there main cage unless they get a lot of run time 8+ hours. I like that it opens from the top and front. The top opening is very useful when I just need to drop some food or toys in.
customer_reviews.author: Myranda Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good I guess.
customer_reviews.text: This cage is huge! I ended up getting a this one for my bunny and attached his original cage to it so he had more room to hop around. We live in an apartment so he can't hop around freely. He absolutely loves it the only thing thought is one of the prongs for putting the cage broke off immediately. Also the tray underneath is really difficult to get to. But other than that the cage is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Smith

customer_reviews.title: Easy clean, but bottom tray warped in sun
customer_reviews.text: Love it ,just what you need for rabbits. And you can buy a little plastic trays to put the new if you want to cushion your rabbit's feet. So easy to clean. Edited because of the bottom tray, left it out in the sun for a while and it warped really bad useless now I've had other trays but they haven't done this before.
customer_reviews.author: patricia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for dwarf rabbits
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my daughters Netherland dwarf rabbit. It is perfect size for the bunny and little hideout igloo, plus plenty of room to run around. my ONLY issue is the latch isn't that great. I added an extra latch for security. I would buy again and would definitely recommend again.
customer_reviews.author: JChilds

customer_reviews.title: Lift your bunny above it all....
customer_reviews.text: Ingenious design where pee and poops drop down into the tray beneath where your pet lives. No more animals living in their own waste. I line the tray with some wee wee pads and clean up is a cinch.
customer_reviews.author: LocoLoco

customer_reviews.title: fantastic fortified fortress for your furry friend
customer_reviews.text: This cage has been a great size for our small Polish dwarf bunny. It is easy to assemble, disassemble, open, close, and clean. It has held up well for months. We would purchase it again. We placed a couple of untreated wood pieces in there so she can rest her feet on them, but the cage bottom must be comfortable to her feet because she rarely sits on the wood when she is in the cage.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Owens

customer_reviews.title: Easy clean up
customer_reviews.text: Our rabbit loves it’s new cage. It’s very roomy for 1 lrgw bunny. I love the 2 door access point. The urine splash guard is a great item!!! Wish they made it to go all the way around! The tray is so easy to take out and clean. We personally use puppy pads in it and it’s such an easy clean up. I would recommend this for any bunny owner.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L

customer_reviews.title: Great for chicks too...
customer_reviews.text: Not only a rabbit cage, I am using this for my 5 chicks that is 3 wks of age, at first they had to get use to without their wood shavings. For their entertainment I shall place a small mirror and sticks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible cage! The tray is not deep enough. Each time the rabbit pees it goes all out. Constant cleaning when all goes outside the cage and bad smell. Because of such it damaged the table that I put the cage on. Also doesn't keeps it clean even with the bedding in it since it fills up very quickly and is time to clean again. Unfortunately I can not return the cage for a refund because I threw away the box. My mistake. Based on my experience I don't reccomend this cage.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn Arrillaga

customer_reviews.title: Its great! we did keep our little lop ear guy ...
customer_reviews.text: Wabbitat! Its great! we did keep our little lop ear guy in here, but he prefers to live on the porch, and use his wabbitat to eat and drink in and sometimes he'll snooze in there too. Easy to clean, lots of space, top and side openings for easy access..
customer_reviews.author: Hillary

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our new bunny
customer_reviews.text: This cage was super easy to put up and is perfect for our new bunny! The slide out tray at the bottom is the best thing ever. We line it with newspaper and the odor absorbing chips. It is super easy to clean. My 3 year old knows how to open the cage from the top to pet him and the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Faithnlove

customer_reviews.title: Two pieces!
customer_reviews.text: Beware. These do not prevent urine from running down your cage. It comes in two pieces with an open seam in the corner! Which you cannot tell from the picture. Worthless. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good folding cage
customer_reviews.text: Cage was good overall. The assembly instructions were not great. We never did figure out how to use a couple of pieces or how to pull the bottom out for cleaning. I love that it folds for storage though so still recommend. Maybe you can figure out the instructions better than me.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Reichenau

product_meta.title: Midwest Wabbitat Folding Rabbit Cage
product_meta.description:
Style:Rabbit Cage | 37L x 19W x 20H InchesWabbitat is the perfect rabbit habitat. It’s durable, affordable, and it makes the best starter home for your furry family member. Wabbitat sets up easily in seconds with no tools or connecting pieces needed for assembly. It features unique slide-latches on the large top and front door openings for one-handed operation, allowing ease of use when interacting with your pet or taking him in or out of his home. The durable, slide-out ABS plastic pan with locking pan stop is also easy to install and remove for trouble-free cleaning and cage maintenance. We at MidWest Homes for Pets understand your pet is a part of your family & that's why we ensure our cages are manufactured with the highest quality control standards creating a safe home for your pet. MidWest Homes for Pets stands behind the quality of our products with a 1 Year Manufacturer's Warranty. If you have any questions about our products our customer service department would be glad to help you. MidWest customer service can be contacted.

AMAZON.COM



 Wabbitat is the perfect rabbit habitat. It’s durable, affordable, and it makes the best starter home for your furry family member. Wabbitat sets up easily in seconds with no tools or connecting pieces needed for assembly. It features unique slide-latches on the large top and front door openings for one-handed operation, allowing ease of use when interacting with your pet or taking him in or out of his home. The durable, slide-out ABS plastic pan with locking pan stop is also easy to install and remove for trouble-free cleaning and cage maintenance.


 MidWest researched the small animal category in great detail by inviting experts to educate our Research & Design team on the needs of small animals. We found that rabbits are bright, loving, and social animals that need interaction every day with humans or other rabbits. We also learned that rabbit enclosures must be easy to clean, which is vital to pet parents and their pets. Taking this information and adding our quality wire product knowledge resulted in the creation of a trusted line of excellent small-animal products. We ensure that our products are manufactured following strict quality assurance procedures, procedures that are conducted during each step in our manufacturing process and full-scale, random quality inspections during the year. Wabbitat carries a one-year limited warranty and support from MidWest’s award-winning customer service team. 






 PRODUCT FEATURES
 

 *  The perfect starter home for your Rabbit 
 *  Sets Up Complete in Seconds – No Tools or Connecting Pieces Required 
 *  Unique Design Provides Versatile Top and Front Door Access 
 *  Secure Slide Latch Allows for One-Handed Door Operation 
 *  Easy to Slide Out and Clean Front Access Durable Plastic Pan 
 *  Includes Urine Guard, Protecting Surrounding Areas from Urine Splash 
 *  ½” Grid Mesh Floor Supports and Hygienically Protects Rabbit’s Hocks 
 *  Black Electrocoat Finish Provides Long Lasting Protection 








 CLEANING INSTRUCTIONS 
 Using a mild, pet-safe cleanser, use warm water to spray or wipe with a cloth. Avoid abrasive materials, harsh chemicals, and scrubbing as this may damage the finish. Lay the plastic pan flat to air dry and do not expose to prolonged periods of direct sunlight. 


Urine guard can be used with or without the floor grid

ag20095.0 out of 5 stars Excellent CageReviewed in the United States on November 27, 2016Style: Rabbit Cage | 37L x 19W x 20H InchesVerified Purchase Great cage and was super easy to put up. We use it for a Rex rabbit and she has plenty of space for herself, food / water dish and a mat. The pull out tray has been a life saver, not flimsy at all to me. One of the other things I really appreciate is that this cage has a door on the side and a door on top, so I can take her dish in and out without her actually needing to be let out (most of the time she is out of her cage, we open it up in the morning and put her back in the evening). I would definitely recommend this cage to anyone with a rabbit or even a small dog that isn't permanently caged up.Read more 62 people found this helpful Helpful Comment Report abuse Amy L.5.0 out of 5 stars Great for larger rabbitsReviewed in the United States on February 1, 2018Style: Rabbit Cage | 37L x 19W x 20H InchesVerified Purchase We breed meat rabbits for our family use, and use these cages for our 4 breeding does, 10-12 lb rabbits. We did not like the smaller ones availabe at our local farm store.  Wabbitat is the perfect rabbit habitat. It’s durable, affordable, and it makes the best starter home for your furry family member. Wabbitat sets up easily in seconds with no tools or connecting pieces needed for assembly. It features unique slide-latches on the large top and front door openings for one-handed operation, allowing ease of use when interacting with your pet or taking him in or out of his home. The durable, slide-out ABS plastic pan with locking pan stop is also easy to install and remove for trouble-free cleaning and cage maintenance.


 MidWest researched the small animal category in great detail by inviting experts to educate our Research & Design team on the needs of small animals. We found that rabbits are bright, loving, and social animals that need interaction every day with humans or other rabbits. We also learned that rabbit enclosures must be easy to clean, which is vital to pet parents and their pets. Taking this information and adding our quality wire product knowledge resulted in the creation of a trusted line of excellent small-animal products. We ensure that our products are manufactured following strict quality assurance procedures, procedures that are conducted during each step in our manufacturing process and full-scale, random quality inspections during the year. Wabbitat carries a one-year limited warranty and support from MidWest’s award-winning customer service team. 






 PRODUCT FEATURES
 

 *  The perfect starter home for your Rabbit 
 *  Sets Up Complete in Seconds – No Tools or Connecting Pieces Required 
 *  Unique Design Provides Versatile Top and Front Door Access 
 *  Secure Slide Latch Allows for One-Handed Door Operation 
 *  Easy to Slide Out and Clean Front Access Durable Plastic Pan 
 *  Includes Urine Guard, Protecting Surrounding Areas from Urine Splash 
 *  ½” Grid Mesh Floor Supports and Hygienically Protects Rabbit’s Hocks 
 *  Black Electrocoat Finish Provides Long Lasting Protection 








 CLEANING INSTRUCTIONS 
 Using a mild, pet-safe cleanser, use warm water to spray or wipe with a cloth. Avoid abrasive materials, harsh chemicals, and scrubbing as this may damage the finish. Lay the plastic pan flat to air dry and do not expose to prolonged periods of direct sunlight. 


Urine guard can be used with or without the floor grid
